com.amitinside.featureflags.feature.group

Interface FeatureGroup

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Strategizable

    public interface FeatureGroup
extends Strategizable
    A feature group is defined by its name. Feature Groups are registered as OSGi services.

    Feature Group names Strategizable.getName() should be globally unique (case-insensitive). If multiple feature groups have the same name, the feature group with the highest service ranking is accessible through the FeatureService service while those with lower service rankings are ignored. If service rankings are equal, sort by service ID in descending order. That is, services with lower service IDs will be accessible whereas those with higher service IDs are ignored.

    If the feature group is enabled, all the features belonging to it, will by default be enabled. Hence, no associated strategy would be effective on belonging Features.

    To check enablement of any feature group, use FeatureService.isGroupEnabled(String).

    This interface is intended to be implemented by feature providers.
    See Also:
    Feature, FeatureService, ActivationStrategy

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface com.amitinside.featureflags.Strategizable

        getDescription, getName, getStrategy, isEnabled
